description: Employee accessed patient medical records without authorization or business need during data mining activity
Unencrypted laptop containing patient PHI lost by traveling healthcare professional at airport
Workforce members deceived by phishing email to reveal login credentials resulting in unauthorized system access
Ransomware encrypted ePHI systems and attackers demanded ransom but data not confirmed exfiltrated
PHI transmitted via unencrypted email to external party in error affecting multiple patients
Medical records containing PHI discarded in dumpster found by member of public
Hacker exploited database vulnerability to access and exfiltrate patient records
PHI fax containing patient information sent to incorrect fax number but promptly recalled
Employee with system access intentionally downloaded and attempted to sell PHI to third party
Public cloud bucket misconfigured exposed patient records accessible to internet
Patient information visible on unattended workstation accessed by unauthorized visitor
Business associate breach exposing covered entity patient PHI without proper notification
Attacker used weak default password to access system containing hundreds of patient records
Multiple backup tapes containing unencrypted ePHI lost in transit from data center
Fraudster used stolen PHI to obtain medical services and prescription medications
Network traffic captured revealing unencrypted PHI transmissions between systems
Malware installed on clinical workstations logged keystrokes capturing PHI and credentials
File cabinet containing patient medical records stolen from office
Third-party vendor portal compromised exposing connected entity patient data
Attacker compromised provider account credentials and accessed patient records for 90 days undetected
